title: Where Do You Find a Car's VIN?

steps.title: Check the dashboard under the driver’s side windshield.
steps.content: Check the dashboard under the driver’s side windshield. Fordin explains that most VIN plates appear on the lower left-hand side of the dashboard. Sit in the driver’s seat and look on the dashboard in front of the steering wheel. [1] X Expert Source Audra Fordin Certified Automotive Technician Expert Interview. 13 January 2022. Alternately, you might be able to see the VIN easier by standing outside the vehicle and looking through the windshield. [2] X Trustworthy Source National Highway Traffic Safety Administration U.S. government agency responsible for writing and enforcing Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards Go to source The VIN should have 17 characters if the car was manufactured after 1981. Vehicles manufactured before that date had VINs from 11 to 17 characters. [3] X Research source A typical VIN might read 1HGBM22JXMN109186.

steps.title: Check the front of the car frame.
steps.content: Check the front of the car frame. Fordin points out that sometimes, the VIN will appear on the car frame, near the windshield washer container. [4] X Expert Source Audra Fordin Certified Automotive Technician Expert Interview. 13 January 2022. Crouch down in front of the car on the driver’s side and check. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Check the driver-side doorjamb.
steps.content: Check the driver-side doorjamb. According to Fordin, the VIN should also appear on the Federal Safety Certification Label which is in all new cars. [6] X Expert Source Audra Fordin Certified Automotive Technician Expert Interview. 13 January 2022. This label should appear on the driver’s side door in the following places: [7] X Research source On the driver-side doorpost. With the door open, check the spot where the door latches. It should be near the seatbelt return. Inside the driver-side doorjamb. Open the door and look straight ahead. The VIN should be inside the doorjamb, where the mirror is located when the door is shut.

steps.title: Pick up the spare tire to look for a VIN sticker underneath.
steps.content: Pick up the spare tire to look for a VIN sticker underneath. The VIN sometimes appears underneath the spare tire, which is usually in the trunk. [8] X Research source Pick up the tire to check.

steps.title: Peek in the rear wheel well for a backup VIN label.
steps.content: Peek in the rear wheel well for a backup VIN label. Crouch down beside the car, near the rear wheel on the driver’s side. Look up into the well, above the tire. The VIN might be located there, inside the wheel well. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Look in front of the engine block for a VIN plate.
steps.content: Look in front of the engine block for a VIN plate. Fordin explains that you may be able to pop open the hood and check the front of the engine to find the VIN. [10] X Expert Source Audra Fordin Certified Automotive Technician Expert Interview. 13 January 2022. Some manufacturers affix a body plate that contains the VIN or a partial VIN (typically the last eight characters). This plate should be attached to the firewall inside the engine compartment. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Check the title to find your VIN.
steps.content: Check the title to find your VIN. You can find the VIN on the title document. It will appear in different places, depending on your state, but should be on the front of the title near the top. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Find the VIN on your registration card.
steps.content: Find the VIN on your registration card. The VIN should also appear on the front of your registration card. Contact your Department of Motor Vehicles if you don’t have a registration card for the car. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Call the dealership or manufacturer to ask for help.
steps.content: Call the dealership or manufacturer to ask for help. If you’ve looked everywhere but couldn’t find the VIN, call whoever sold you the car (or made it) and ask for help. [14] X Research source Give them the make and model of your car and ask where the VIN is located. They may even be able to look the vin up for you.

steps.title: Check the info on your insurance documents.
steps.content: Check the info on your insurance documents. You probably had to provide the VIN to your insurer, so check your insurance card or insurance policy. The VIN should be listed on the policy, card, and any other documents that contain identifying informationyou’re your vehicle. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the MOT certificate (in Britain).
steps.content: Look at the MOT certificate (in Britain). If the car is older and has an MOT certificate, the VIN is the first item listed on that certificate. [16] X Trustworthy Source Official UK government website Official website for the public sector of the UK government Go to source Just FYI, the VIN is also known as the chassis number in the UK. These are the same thing.

steps.title: Read the owner’s manual.
steps.content: Read the owner’s manual. The VIN should also appear in the owner’s manual that came with the car. [17] X Research source If the car is new, you should have the manual. However, you might not have it if you bought a used car.

steps.title: Feel the VIN plate on the dashboard.
steps.content: Feel the VIN plate on the dashboard. The VIN will either be printed on a plate or on a label. Either should be securely fastened to the dashboard. There also shouldn’t be any scratches on the VIN label or on the surrounding area, such as the windshield or dashboard. Also look for signs that the windshield may have been removed in order to pull off the VIN plate. For example, there may be loose molding or excessive glue on the windshield.

steps.title: Check the Federal Safety Certification Label.
steps.content: Check the Federal Safety Certification Label. In the US, Federal law requires newer vehicles have a safety label, which should contain the VIN. This label is typically located inside the driver’s side door, and is affixed to the rear or forward door pillar post. It may also be on the door itself. [18] X Research source Check for signs the label may have been tampered with: The label should be entirely fastened to the vehicle without any loose corners. There shouldn’t be any tears or scratches on the label. In particular, pay attention to the VIN. The label should have a shiny clear coat. The label should be smooth to the touch, without scratches. The label shouldn’t be partially obscured with a screw or rust proofing material. The VIN on the certification label should match the VINs that appear elsewhere on the vehicle.

steps.title: Assess the VIN plate attached to the engine.
steps.content: Assess the VIN plate attached to the engine. Check for signs that the plate has been modified or moved. For example, there may be rivet holes where the plate was fastened. Alternately, you might notice that the plate is much cleaner than the rest of the firewall, which is a sign the plate is fake. [19] X Research source Remember to match the VIN on the plate to the VIN that appears on the dashboard. A lot of cars do not have a VIN number on the engine block, so if the engine plate is missing it isn’t necessarily a sign that anything suspicious has occurred.

steps.title: Ask a mechanic to inspect your car.
steps.content: Ask a mechanic to inspect your car. A mechanic might be able to spot whether the car is a fake better than you can. For example, the mechanic can easily find the VINs on a car and make sure they are consistent. The mechanic might also be able to tell if the VIN plate or label has been tampered with. [20] X Research source If you are buying a used car, always insist on taking it to a mechanic before you make an offer to buy the vehicle.

steps.title: Perform a VIN check to see if the car is reported stolen.
steps.content: Perform a VIN check to see if the car is reported stolen. Visit the National Insurance Crime Bureau’s website to perform a VIN check. When a car is reported stolen, the VIN will be entered into the database. [21] X Research source Some thieves will pull VIN plates and labels from cars that have been junked or stolen. They then attach the plate/label to their stolen car. Call the police if the VIN shows up in the database.

steps.title: Analyze the car’s service report using Carfax’s VIN lookup.
steps.content: Analyze the car’s service report using Carfax’s VIN lookup . You used to need to buy service reports, but you can look them up for free these days. [22] X Research source Enter the VIN number in the lookup tool and check to see that the car described in the report matches the car with the VIN. For example, the service report might describe the car as a 2016 Honda Accord, but the car you have been looking at is a 2015 Subaru. In this situation, the VIN has been stolen from one car and put on another.

steps.title: What does the VIN number tell you?
steps.content: What does the VIN number tell you? A car’s VIN is sort of the equivalent to your social security number. It is the most secure way to prove that the vehicle is actually the correct make, model, mileage, color, etc. A VIN can also tell people what kind of work has been performed on the vehicle or [23] X Research source

steps.title: How is a VIN used for a vehicle history report?
steps.content: How is a VIN used for a vehicle history report? Every repair, serious incident, crash, and recall is recorded. Those recordings are tied to your vehicle’s VIN—not its make, model, plate, etc. So, the VIN is the only way to prove that a vehicle’s history is accurate. Without the VIN, there’s no way to actually demonstrate that certain repairs or crashes occurred. [24] X Research source This is why it’s dangerous to buy a car without a valid and matching VIN. You cannot prove that the vehicle wasn’t totaled or stolen at some point.

steps.title: Why Is My VIN number important?
steps.content: Why Is My VIN number important? The VIN is the only 100% accurate way to identify a vehicle. Without a VIN, you’d never be able to register your vehicle, get insurance, or prove that you even own the vehicle in the first place. [25] X Research source
